_description: On the pestilence, from the Latin — 117 lines, in couplets

BLEge1624.First Lines:
Here begynys a tretis fyneMade in Ynglis owt of
                    Latyne…
BLEge1624.Last Lines:
…Her ar medycyns many ches ȝou of the bestFor I wyll
                    trett no more bot now go to my rest
BLEge1624.Editions:
Bowers,  Robert Hood. 
             “A Middle English Mnemonic Plague Tract.” 
             Southern Folklore Quarterly
         20 (1956): 118-25: 120-3.
